artist: Artist: Federico Zuccaro; Artist: verso attributed to Antonio Viviani
description: recto: seated Madonna holding standing Christ child, on clouds at top center, surrounded by angels and cherubs in a ring, hand in hand; at bottom, three standing male saints, from left: John the Baptist with his cross, man holding an open book, man holding a closed book in his PL hand and man in bishop's hat with crozier; verso: scene of the descent from the cross with Mary behind Jesus, holding him beneath this PL arm; praying and mourning figures surround Jesus, with two ladders behind them; lower left corner of drawing is missing
dimension:
18 3/4 x 10 15/16 in. (47.7 x 27.78 cm) (sheet, recto)
12 1/2 x 8 3/8 in. (31.75 x 21.27 cm) (sheet, verso, irregular)
18 13/16 x 10 15/16 in. (47.78 x 27.78 cm) (mount, as folded)
inscription:
Inscription

on back, in brown ink: [TADDEO ZUCCARO. Capella della Passione di N.o Sig. le che è / Lorenzino da Bologna scol.o del Pellegrino / e de Prbsp.o font.a dipinse in un altare à m.o manca / entrando in Segrestia di S. Pietro in Vaticano.] and [dicono, e si vede, che l\'inventione è di / M. Angelo Buonaruota. una copia fatta / dal Viviano d. il Sordo d\'Urbino scol.o di / Baroccio, sta ad una capella alla Madonna de Monti]

Resta-Somers inventory number: f.9.
provenance: Padre Sebastiano Resta, Lugt 2992 (1635-1714); Monsignor Giovanni Matteo Marchetti, Bishop of Arezzo (until d. 1704); his nephew, Cavaliere Marchetti da Pistoia (1704-10; sold, through John Talman, to Somers); John, Lord Somers, Lugt 2981 (1650-1716). Sale, Sotheby's, London, July 9, 2003, no. 16, to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (2003-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Madonna and Child with Four Saints (recto); Pietà (verso)
